_comment: Example requirements JSON for init_spec.py. Use this as a template when collecting user requirements.
_note: Using --auto-dir creates isolated directory (specs/001-feature-name/) with automatic numbering for concurrent feature development.
overview: Add OAuth2 authentication support for third-party login providers
user_requirements: Users should be able to login using Google, GitHub, or Microsoft accounts instead of traditional username/password authentication
business_value: Reduce friction in user onboarding process
Eliminate password management overhead for users
Improve security with industry-standard OAuth2 flows
target_users: End users who prefer social login
Enterprise users with existing OAuth2 providers
constraints: Must support PKCE flow for enhanced security
Must work with existing session management system
Must not break current local authentication
acceptance_criteria: Users can login with Google OAuth2
Users can login with GitHub OAuth2
Users can login with Microsoft OAuth2
Existing local auth continues to work
All OAuth2 flows pass security audit
questions: Should we support token refresh in the background?
What should happen if OAuth2 provider is down?
Do we need admin interface for provider configuration?
